mean_en: ne of the two groups of elected politicians who make laws in some countries, for example in the US, Australia, Canada and France. The Senate is smaller than the other group but higher in rank. Many state parliaments in the US also have a Senate.
sentence: Several politicians are talking in front of the United States Senate.
sentence_trans: 几个政治家在美国参议院前面交谈。
word_etyma: sen老 + ate名词后缀  → 参议院，上议院，古罗马的元老院议员
